node.title: 'Good as it gets': Despite COVID-19 respite, Australian hospitals 'overwhelmed' as states prepare for Delta influx
node.alt: A nurse stands in PPE in a hospital corridor.
node.description: Australian hospitals are already overwhelmed and falling behind, even with the "once-in-a-generation" slowdown in patient numbers that came with COVID-19, an AMA report finds.Â
node.content:
["Australian hospitals are already overwhelmed and falling behind, even with the \"once-in-a-generation\" slowdown in patient numbers that came with COVID-19, an AMA report has found.\u00a0", "The Australian Medical Association's Public Hospital Report Card 2021, released on Friday, highlights the dire state of Australia's public health system.", "According to\u00a0Australian Medical Association's president, Omar Khorshid, the hospital system\u00a0showed some improvements during COVID-19, when patient levels dropped, but \"not to the level we thought it should be\".\u00a0\u00a0", "And, he said, it was\u00a0about to get \"much worse\".\u00a0", "\"Public hospitals [today] are in a very different situation to earlier in the pandemic,\" Dr Khorshid told the ABC.", "\"The virus will become endemic and this will intensify pressure on an already-stretched public hospital system.\"", "", "
AMA national president Dr Omar Khorshid says\u00a0there are\u00a0signs that hospitals, if given the capacity they need, can\u00a0improve their performance.(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "The annual\u00a0report assesses the state of emergency departments, elective surgeries and public hospital funding across the country.\u00a0", "Dr Khorshid said the AMA report's\u00a0key finding was the time it took for Australians requiring\u00a0urgent care to receive treatment.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "\"If you're classed as 'urgent', which can include being severely ill, bleeding heavily from cuts,\u00a0having a major fracture or severe hypertension,\u00a0you have a one-in-three chance of being seen within 30\u00a0minutes in the ACT and [about] a one-in-two chance in South Australia and Western Australia,\" Dr Khorshid said.\u00a0", "\"At the very best, in New South Wales,\u00a0you'll have a three-in-four\u00a0chance of being seen in 30 minutes after\u00a0arriving at the hospital.", "According to the report, the number of patients leaving the emergency departments within four hours dropped to 69 per cent, its worst\u00a0level since 2012\u201313.\u00a0\u00a0", "It comes as state and territory health ministers call\u00a0for \"crisis funding\"\u00a0for hospitals as all states in\u00a0Australia prepare\u00a0to ease COVID-19 restrictions.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "The report also found the\u00a0number of patients presenting to\u00a0EDs dropped by 1.4 per cent in 201920 \u2014\u00a0a temporary reversal of the trend of 3.2 per cent year-on-year growth over the previous five years.", "Dr Khorshid said that drop was attributed to the COVID-19 lockdowns.\u00a0", "But, he said, the data showed that no matter where they\u00a0lived, Australians relying\u00a0on the public hospital system would have\u00a0to wait longer for elective surgery and treatment.\u00a0", "The Australasian College for Emergency Medicine's president-elect, Clare Skinner, said nothing in the report came as \"a surprise\".\u00a0", "Dr Skinner, who works as a senior staff specialist at Ku-ring-gai Hospital in Sydney, said the data just\u00a0highlighted how under pressure\u00a0the hospital system was, and would\u00a0continue to be.\u00a0", "\"We have consistent evidence that the system has been under too much pressure for years and years,\" Dr Skinner said.\u00a0", "On a positive, Dr Skinner said, the report showed that the pressures in the system were not evenly distributed across the states.\u00a0", "She said there was clear evidence to show that when governments prioritised certain elements, those areas showed\u00a0improvement.\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
Australasian College for Emergency Medicine's president-elect, Dr Clare Skinner, says\u00a0the hospital system has\u00a0been stretched for years.(Supplied)
", "\"Then, in Western Australia, which has emphasised everyone being seen within a four-hour time, it performed the best at that.\u00a0", "\"It shows that, if\u00a0governments put structures into addressing emergency departments' flow and performance, it works.\"\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "A spokesperson\u00a0for Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt said the government had made a \"significant funding contribution\"\u00a0to assist states and territories with the costs of delivering public hospital services through the National Health Reform Agreement (NHRA).", "\"Our funding contribution for public hospitals services in all states and territories [has] grown substantially from $13.3 billion in 2012-13 to $25.5 billion in 2019-20, or by 92 per cent,\" the spokesperson said in a statement.\u00a0\u00a0", "The spokesperson said under the new 2020-2025\u00a0NHRA, the\u00a0funding contribution for public hospitals services in all states and territories was\u00a0estimated to increase from $103 billion between 2015-16 and 2019-20 to $135.4 billion between 2020-21 and 2024-25.", "", "
